intro: Enodium caeruleum var. secundum, commonly known as the blue enodium, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking blue-violet blooms. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is native to specific regions in southern Europe. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
